lexUnit.name: flake.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small, flat, very thin piece of something.

sentence.text: Drizzle with olive oil and top with flakes of fresh Parmesan for an elegant starter .
The torrents are loosening high mountain rocks and soil , and are washing downstream with the gravel tiny flakes of gold .
Flat flakes of gold are more difficult to trap as their weight to surface area is small and they have a tendency to escape over the edge .
A little black flake of mascara 's got trapped behind it .
The flakes of mud would have been carefully removed and put in the rubbish bin in the kitchen .
Break up chocolate flakes , press some around sides and decorate with strawberries and the remaining chocolate flakes .
The Nubian looked up from the couch where she half lay by a low table on which a number of limestone flakes were scattered .
The white chair looks soluble , as if it might crumble , collapsing into a pile of infinitesimal white flakes .
Raddled nets trailed at grey window-panes , flakes of plaster flecked the bare boards , newsprint , piss-yellow with age , scrunched at her feet .
She nibbled a few more flakes of meat and dropped the bone back on to her plate .
Flat flakes of gold are more difficult to trap as their weight to surface area is small and they have a tendency to escape over the edge .
Although these may be later broken down physically to release individual particles there is no guarantee that individual flakes of clay would become separated by purely physical means .
The yolk blends into the red sauce , leaving flakes of egg white among the beans .
But we looked , and there were flakes of stone in the grass below , and these fresh marks .
He licks butter and flakes of croissant off his finger , and turns to the Michelin , impatient to get started on actually looking at things .

She was conscious of a faint but unappetising body odour which hinted , faintly but unmistakeably , at sweat-stained underwear , unwashed socks , spaces between the teeth of combs clogged with large greasy flakes of dandruff .
For some reason it began in a thick snowstorm of large white flakes .
The satin bowerbird uses a ` brush " , usually a small flake of bark , to apply the paint to its bower ; the other two species use their beaks .
Small flakes of rock were dropping out of the roof around the ring pitons .
Other officers got on hands and knees to collect red flakes of the benches ' paint from the track for forensic examination .
The baboon has a bath every day and he leaves dark wisps of hair all over the place , and little crumbs of plaster and flakes of paint .
And when the snow thawed and took with it the paint they had daubed it with , he was out there picking off the remaining flakes of paint , and cursing with disappointment .
Flakes of torn skin curl back from the wound like pith on an orange .
As he watched , the first few flakes of snow came swirling down .
Dark flakes of snow tumbled past the candlelit windows of the Countess of Ratho 's townhouse in Charlotte Square .
As they turned the corner , the first flakes of snow fell .
